poem:
Title: Solitude Seeks Justice 

Amidst echoes of forgotten lore, 
A grey teacher on Jerusalem's floor,
Cries in confinement, cold and hollow.
His words of concern, once swallowed, 
now echo against prison walls. 

A civics lesson, his lone call-
Injustice lays Gaza low, see her fall!
Yet he is the treason-tongued crook,
In Israel's despotic book. 
For concern, faces iron curtain's gall.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘It is a time of witch hunts in Israel’: teacher held in solitary confinement for posting concern about Gaza deaths An unlikely charge of intent to commit treason landed Meir Baruchin, a grey-haired, softly spoken history and civics teacher, in the solitary confinement wing of Jerusalem’s notorious “Russian Compound” prison in early November. The evidence compiled by police who handcuffed him, then drove to his apartment and ransacked it as he watched, was a series". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
